image.altText: An in-flight picture of an airliner over a beach, the plane in purple and white livery showing the word "Bonza".

props.synopsis: Bonza customers receive text messages notifying them their flights between Darwin and the Gold Coast are cancelled until March 19, nearly a month after the airline cancelled all its flights along the route for December.

title.children: Bonza extends its cancellation of all flights on Darwin-Gold Coast route until mid-March

image.altText: Cliffs, sand and surf at Ethel Beach in South Australia.

props.synopsis: A teenage boy dies in a shark attack near Ethel Beach — a popular spot for tourism and surfing on the south-western tip of South Australia's Yorke Peninsula.

title.children: Teen killed in shark attack off coast of Yorke Peninsula in SA

image.altText: Photo of woman with running shoes and in running gear smiling

props.synopsis: Tanya Hehir, 46, was one of three women who went exploring the so-called "love tunnel" in Gympie. Police said the women, including another 40-year-old who also died, had been washed back through the drain into Mary River.

title.children: Police confirm identity of woman who died while exploring 'love tunnel' stormwater drain in Gympie

image.altText: The icon for the video sharing TikTok app is seen on a smartphone.

props.synopsis: The Australian Information Commissioner is inquiring into social media giant TikTok's handling of personal data and allegations it took data without consent.

title.children: Australian privacy watchdog investigating claims TikTok harvests your data even if you don't have the app

image.altText: A woman cries in front of a car.

props.synopsis: Two people are under arrest following an alleged burglary at the home of accused triple murderer Erin Patterson in Victoria's east.

title.children: Two arrested over robbery at home of Victoria's fatal mushroom meal

image.altText: a flight attendant talks to passengers while walking down the aisle of a plane

props.synopsis: As any frequent social media user knows, airline passengers often record and post in-flight incidents — from frightening turbulence to unruly travellers. The trend is now emerging as an industrial issue.

title.children: Flight attendants filmed without their consent for viral videos and it's becoming an industrial issue

image.altText: Mir Hamza celebrates with Babar Azam

props.synopsis: Pakistan was in pole position to win the Boxing Day Test after rolling Australia's top order, but a costly drop slammed the brakes on the tourists's momentum. Here's the five quick hits from day three at the MCG.

title.children: Five quick hits — Pakistan blows its chance after an Australian collapse and Captain Pat steps up

image.altText: Australia batter Mitch Marsh raises his bat during the MCG Test.

props.synopsis: The career revival of Mitch Marsh is perhaps not entirely unique but that doesn't make watching it unfold any less exceptional, with the once-maligned all-rounder's star turn at the MCG adding another page to the epilogue era of his Test career.

title.children: Mitch Marsh, the benefits of living dangerously and why it helps to care a little less

image.altText: Tom and CJ In 2022 with the National Wheelchair Basketball League championship trophy.

props.synopsis: Tom and CJ have been friends for decades. Now the two mates, who had to leave home for their sporting opportunities, have reunited to bring those opportunities home.

title.children: 'You cannot be what you cannot see': How two Darwin friends helped form the Darwin Salties

image.altText: A sign reading welcome to Rosebud Pier, with the pier behind it.

props.synopsis: A man has been found dead after disappearing off the coast of Rosebud, on Melbourne's Mornington Peninsula.

title.children: Body of missing kayaker recovered from water off Melbourne's Mornington Peninsula

image.altText: A close up of a man and a younger man smiling slightly while standing behind glass. Reflected in the glass is a room of people

props.synopsis: A Moscow court sentences two poets to years-long prison terms after they were convicted of "inciting hatred".

title.children: Russian poets sentenced to prison for reciting poems against Ukraine war

image.altText: A Hong Kong police car.

props.synopsis: Ho Yu-wang, 20, Kwok Man-hei, 21, and Cheung Ho-yeung, 23, were all charged with "conspiracy to commit terrorism" under the National Security Law.

title.children: Hong Kong activists jailed for up to six years over foiled bomb plot

image.altText: A man, woman and child carry luggage as they wade through knee-deep water in front of a barbed wire fence.

props.synopsis: Mexico's president says he is willing to help, but wants to see progress in US relations with Cuba and Venezuela, along with more development aid for the region.

title.children: Mexico uses bulldozers, machetes to clear migrant camp on US border as US secretary of state visits Mexico City

image.altText: Gypsy Rose Blanchard wearing glasses hugs her mother Clauddine Blanchard as well as a small puppy

props.synopsis: Gypsy Rose Blanchard, 32, is set to be released on parole after being jailed for secondary-degree murder over the killing of her mother, who forced her to pretend she was suffering from Leukaemia, muscular dystrophy and other illnesses.

title.children: US woman Gypsy Rose Blanchard set to be paroled years after persuading boyfriend to kill abusive mother

image.altText: An old stone building with a vineyard.

props.synopsis: Tourism leaders say South Australia's Limestone Coast needs more accommodation to suit a range of budgets to reach its full potential as a holiday destination.

title.children: It has world-class wines and scenery galore, but a lack of tourist beds could be holding this region back

image.altText: Two huge sailing yachts on the River Derwent with Hobart behind them.

props.synopsis: The owner of the victorious Sydney to Hobart yacht thinks it's "rough as anything", despite pulling off a nailbiting finish in slow motion. So how did LawConnect do it?

title.children: LawConnect just pulled off a nail-biting victory but the owner says the yacht is 'rough as anything'

image.altText: Signage on a glass fronted building reads 'The New York Times' in a calligraphic font

props.synopsis: The New York Times is taking legal action against Microsoft and OpenAI over their artificial intelligence-powered programs. This is what it alleges the chatbots are up to.

title.children: 'The cost to society will be enormous': Here's why the New York Times has just sued two tech titans

image.altText: Woman weep opening whle wearing black and yellow sashes while holding pictures of three people

props.synopsis: Australian man Ali Bazzi, who Hezbollah said was a fighter, and his brother Ibrahim, along with Ibrahim's wife Shorouk Hammoud, died when the explosion levelled a family-owned home in southern Lebanon on Tuesday.

title.children: Military-style funeral held for Australian 'Hezbollah fighter' killed by Israeli air strike in Lebanon

image.altText: Two bottles of Yakult - the probiotic drink - posed on a kitchen table for a marketing photo

props.synopsis: Probiotic company Yakult Australia is hit by a cyber attack, resulting in 95 gigabytes of data, including sensitive employee data, being published on the dark web, the ABC can confirm.

title.children: Employee files published on dark web after Yakult Australia targeted in cyber attack

image.altText: A group of Australian tennis players stand on a beach, some holding racquets, with an Australian flag in front of them.

props.synopsis: Australia's United Cup campaign begins in Perth on Friday night when players take on a Great Britain outfit featuring Cameron Norrie and Katie Boulter.

title.children: Hewitt backs Aussie underdogs to show plenty of bite at United Cup

image.altText: Alyssa Healy looks to her right during an ODI in the women's Ashes series.

props.synopsis: After going down in the one-off Test before Christmas, Australia faces India again in the first of three ODIs in Mumbai. Follow our ScoreCentre.

title.children: ODI live: India host Aussies in series opener

image.altText: Australia batter Mitch Marsh looks to the sky while walking off the MCG after being dismissed for 96.

props.synopsis: Mitch Marsh falls on 96 and Steve Smith is out for 50 off 176 after they rebuilt Australia's second innings on day three after the top order's collapse.

title.children: Steve Smith falls in final over before stumps after rescuing Australia with Mitch Marsh

image.altText: An aerial view of a fallen tree on a property.

props.synopsis: A child has died at a private property in Victoria's north after being struck by a large tree branch, police say.

title.children: Child dies after being struck by falling tree branch in Victoria's north

image.altText: A wide shot of Len La Tous's devastated home from the Christmas Day storms.

props.synopsis: More intense storms are forecast to hit south-east Queensland on the weekend, just days after the region endured several deadly weather systems, including a "mini cyclone".

title.children: More storms, heatwaves inbound for south-east Queensland after region cops destructive tornado

image.altText: Three Indian warships sailing in a line.

props.synopsis: Two of the world's busiest shipping lanes are under threat in the Middle East. Here's why India felt the need to send its warships in.

title.children: Pirates and rebels on the seas: Why India is sending three warships west

image.altText: Sign telling people to ignore GPS instructions in Quairading.

props.synopsis: A shire in Western Australia's Wheatbelt has erected signs warning travellers to ignore GPS directions as they are sending drivers to unsealed, often treacherous roads.

title.children: 'Your GPS is wrong': Council acts after Google maps repeatedly sends drivers onto unsafe roads

image.altText: A firefighter works to rescue a man inside a badly damaged truck under a bridge

props.synopsis: Two men scouting for fishing spots in north-west Indiana discover a badly damaged truck beneath a highway bridge, with a man barely alive inside.

title.children: Man survives on rainwater for six days trapped inside truck crashed under US bridge

image.altText: A woman wearing an ochre jumper compares a collared cloth shirt with a blue knitted jumper. The photo is taken from behind.

props.synopsis: Being a savvy consumer doesn't mean buying the cheapest thing possible — and "cost per wear" can help you find a true bargain.

title.children: The mental calculation that can save you money when buying clothes
